author: Adam Kurkjian
title: Andrew Luck back throwing: 'I feel like I'm on track' | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
text:
For thie first time since injuring his right shoulder, Colts quarterback Andrew Luck threw short and intermediate passes at practice Wednesday.
Luck, who suffered his injury against the Titans in his team's third game of the season, said he feels his recovery is going in the right direction heading into Sunday night's showdown with the Patriots.
"Certainly, that was the next step," Luck said. "I'm getting better and better and I feel like I'm on track."
He was listed as limited and day-to-day but he dressed in pads and reports are that he was accurate to on short and intermediate throws with longer passes later on in the session. Colts coach Chuck Pagano said Wednesday that he's "hopeful" Luck will return but doesn't know for sure and that whenever he comes back, "he'll be fine."
Luck said it's a continual process.
"I'm constantly self-evaluating â€” am I better than I was yesterday or worse?" Luck said. "That part is probably getting better every day and I'm getting closer to where I want to be."
Although Matt Hasselbeck has led the Colts to three straight victories in his stead, it's Luck that will likely take the field if he's able. According to him, he's improving.
"I'm throwing better, moving faster," he said. "I'm doing everything better and with less restriction."
